text: President Obama has decided to attend
the climate change conference in
Copenhagen next month at the conference
he'll offer to reduce greenhouse gas
emissions about seventeen percent below
2005 levels by 2020 the conference is
not expected to resolve in any kind of
binding climate treaty and until now the
President had not been committed to
making an appearance but he's agreed to
deliver a speech on December 9th in
route to Oslo Norway where he'll accept
the nobel peace prize on December 10th
Times reporter John Broder is working on
the story and we spoke earlier about the
evolving White House strategy I think
they made the calculation and it's a bit
of a gamble that he can take to
Copenhagen a list of accomplishments of
his administration so far and the
targets for greenhouse gas reductions
that the House passed in June it would
begin to change how utilities generate
electricity Cole will still be roughly
half of the fuel used to generate
electricity in this country but
utilities are going to have to begin to
find a way to capture some of the carbon
dioxide emissions from the burning of
that coal and begin to find other fuels
for powering their electricity
generating stations the most obvious one
of course being natural gas
